article.description: Joe Hugley scored 20 points and made a key 3-pointer in overtime to help Central Connecticut beat St. Francis (Brooklyn) 78-75 on Saturday in a Northeast Conference regular season finale.
article.headline: Central Connecticut beats St. Francis (Brooklyn) 78-75 in OT
article.linkText: Central Connecticut beats St. Francis (Brooklyn) 78-75 in OT
article.story: NEW BRITAIN, Conn. -- Joe Hugley scored 20 points and made a key 3-pointer in overtime to help Central Connecticut beat St. Francis (Brooklyn) 78-75 on Saturday in a Northeast Conference regular season finale. Central Connecticut (14-17, 7-11) clinched the No. 8 seed heading to the conference tournament. St. Francis (13-17, 10-8) will be the fifth or sixth seed. Hugley hit a trey with 1:07 left that gave the Blue Devils a 74-73 lead. Milija Coic answered with a layup for St. Francis, then Eric Bowles took the ball near midcourt and drove the floor for the go-ahead score, and Tyler Kohl added two free throws to seal it for Central Connecticut. Mustafa Jones and Kohl finished with 14 points for the Blue Devils. Rasheem Dunn scored 20 points to lead St. Francis. Glenn Sanabria added 15 points, but missed a layup and a 3 in overtime for the Terriers. Shakaris Laney made a diving steal with 21.3 seconds remaining in regulation that led to two free throws from Bowles to force overtime tied at 69.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
